subject: p12595991
History: Year old woman with chf and low lung volumes with increasing O2 requirements, evaluate for pulm edema.
Impression: As compared to the previous radiograph, the nasogastric tube has been removed. The lung volumes remain extremely low and areas of friable extensive atelectasis are seen at both lung bases. There is no pulmonary edema and no larger pleural effusions are visualized. Mild cardiomegaly. Unchanged position of the left pectoral pacemaker.
